facetValues.label: Ancient Mediterranean and Near Eastern Studies (Vancouver)
Gender, Race, Sexuality and Social Justice (Vancouver)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Introduction to cinema as a serious academic discipline; through the study of film language, genre and ideology, and alternatives to Hollywood filmmaking and analysis, the course focuses on building the terminology and analytical skills necessary for academic engagements with cinema.

NOTE: Students must also register for a discussion group: ONE of CINE 100 Sections D11, D12, or D13. If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
This course is part of the Coordinated Arts Program, Media Studies stream, https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/streams/media-studies/. Students must register in both Term  
1 and Term 2 courses in CAP. 
 
Follow the prompts to register in all stream seminars (1), lectures (2), and tutorials (1-2)  each term. 
 
For step-by-step instructions, please visit: https://cap.arts.ubc.ca/program/registration/ 
 
If you encounter any issues with registration into CAP, please contact us at support.fyip@ubc.ca

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
